render.tex: \title{Matrix Multiplication} \\ %text How to multiply two matrices %

reason.tex: %text For two matrices $A$ and $B$ to be multiplied with each other, the number of columns in $A$ needs to equal the number of rows in $B$. % \begin{align} A_{m\times n}\times B_{n\times o}=C_{m\times o} \end{align} \\ %text The product matrix has as many rows as $A$ and as many columns as $B$. Here is an example, % \begin{align} A&=\left[\begin{array}{ccccc}1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5\end{array}\right],\; B=\left[\begin{array}{c}1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \\ 5\end{array}\right] \\ A\times B&=[(1\times 1)+(2\times 2)+(3\times 3)+(4\times 4)+(5\times 5)] \\ \text{}&=[1+4+9+16+25]=55 \end{align} \\ %text If $A$ and two or more rows, then so would the product matrix. %
